newsitem.title: LATVIA: BALTICS-ECOLOGY DEAL SEEN WITH BORDER AGREEMENT.
newsitem.headline: BALTICS-ECOLOGY DEAL SEEN WITH BORDER AGREEMENT.

text.p: Latvia said on Monday that the se-border with Lithuania should be finalised ahead of further EU accession decisions and an agreement on ecology signed.
"I would be happy to see the sea-border issue solved ahead of important decisions taken by the EU (regarding the Baltics)," Latvian Foreign Minister Valdis Brikavs told a press conference on Monday.
Both countries confirmed their political will in tackling the issue and said that working-groups would continue consultations on May 23 in Riga.
The dispute over the sea-border and off-shore oil reserves has soured relations between the two Baltic neighbours.
Algirdas Saudargas, Lithuania's foreign minister, on a one-day official visit to Latvia, said that a possible way of speeding up the process was to separate border delimitaion and economic issues.
Valdis Birkavs mentioned as an important mile-stone the planned publication of an EU evalutaion of the situation.
